units.title: Culture organoids
units.text: Culture organoids (or organoid co-cultures) in 50 µl of Matrigel and 200 µl of medium in a standard 96-well tissue culture plate.
units.rationale: This is the first actionable step in the protocol for preparing organoid cultures prior to processing.

units.title: S phase cell labeling
units.text: Add 127IdU directly to culture medium to a final concentration of 25 µM (10 µl of 0.5 mM stock added to 200 µl of medium). Gently rotate the plate by hand five times for 10 s to mix the medium and incubate the plate for 25 min at 37 °C and 5% CO2.
units.rationale: This step explicitly labels S-phase cells with a chemical agent, a key procedural action in the protocol.

units.title: Phosphatase and protease inhibitor treatment
units.text: Add the protease inhibitor cocktail (100× stock; see Reagents) and PhosSTOP (40× stock; see Reagents) directly to culture medium, gently rotate the plate by hand five times for 10 s and incubate for 5 min at 37 °C and 5% CO2.
units.rationale: This step preserves signaling integrity by inhibiting enzymatic degradation, a critical procedural action.

units.title: Fixation
units.text: Remove culture medium by pipetting. Add 200 µl of prewarmed (37 °C) 4% (vol/vol) PFA into each well, taking care not to disrupt Matrigel. Incubate for 60 min at 37 °C and 5% CO2.
units.rationale: Fixation in situ is a core procedural step to preserve cellular states and PTM profiles.

units.title: Live/dead discrimination
units.text: Remove PBS by pipetting. Add 200 µl of 0.25 µM 194cisplatin/PBS solution to each well and incubate for 10–15 min on a rocker at room temperature.
units.rationale: This step uses a specific reagent to label dead cells, a key procedural action for downstream analysis.

units.title: TOBis barcoding
units.text: Transfer 200 µl of pre-aliquoted TOBis barcodes to corresponding organoid samples in a 96-well plate (from Step 7). Any barcode combination can be used to stain any culture condition (Supplementary Tables 3 and 4). Incubate the cells overnight at 4 °C.
units.rationale: TOBis barcoding enables multiplexed sample comparison and is a defining procedural step of the protocol.

units.title: Quench TOBis barcodes
units.text: Remove the barcoding solutions by pipetting and wash the cells with 200 µl of 2 mM glutathione/CSB for 10 min on a rocker at room temperature. Repeat the wash twice.
units.rationale: This quenching step is essential to prevent cross-talk and enable accurate demultiplexing.

units.title: Single-cell dissociation
units.text: Make up a dissociation solution of fresh 0.5 mg/ml dispase II, 0.2 mg/ml collagenase IV and 0.2 mg/ml DNase I in PBS at room temperature.
units.rationale: This step prepares the enzymatic cocktail required to dissociate organoids into single cells, a critical procedural action.

units.title: Dissociate organoids
units.text: Dissociate organoids into single cells by using a gentleMACS Octo dissociator and the 'Standard protocol' (see Equipment setup) (Timing: ~50 min).
units.rationale: This specifies the exact instrument and protocol for mechanical dissociation, a core procedural step.

units.title: Extracellular staining
units.text: Prepare extracellular antibody cocktail by mixing the antibody panel (see Supplementary Table 2 for an example) at desired concentrations in CSB (total volume up to 50 µl). Add the extracellular antibody cocktail to the cells, mix thoroughly by pipetting and incubate for 30 min on a rocker at room temperature.
units.rationale: This step defines the preparation and application of extracellular antibodies, a key procedural action in mass cytometry.
